description: personal study ID composed by the first authors’ first surname_year of publication_first title word
species of individuals participating in the study -chimpanzee
name of the two participants that compose the dyad

social = the competitor is present on the other side / nonsocial = there is no competitor present- that cage is empty. Half of the focal_participants started in the social group- the other half in the nonsocial group.
set of trials - mostly occurring on the same day - usually numerical
presentation of the experiment to the participants - usually numerical

focal_participant first = the focal_participant chooses one side before the platform goes to the other cage. Competitor first = the focal_participant chooses one side after the platform has been on the other side (whether or not a competitor is present (social) or not (nonsocial) -  see above)

inference side = the side of the platform where the board is slanted against the piece of food- secret side: the side of the platform where the food is in a small hole- covered flat by the board (Note: this was not always the same side (right/left) but randomized and counterbalanced. Also note: the focal_participant did not see the boards when choosing but had to remember the respective sides and moved a sliding panel to one side- see figure 1 in the paper)
